Dion Sanderson steps up comeback as Birmingham City slapped with Wrexham fine
arts.sum: An FA statement said: “ Birmingham City and Wrexham have been fined following their EFL League One match on Monday 16 September. Dion Sanderson stepped up his comeback with Birmingham City ’s Under-21s in their Professional Development League fixture with Sheffield Wednesday on Monday.

arts.ttl: Former Birmingham City star Ravel Morrison makes shock transfer as new club laud 'statement'
arts.sum: Former Birmingham City midfielder Ravel Morrison has wound up at Precision FC in the second tier of the United Arab Emirates after a long search for a new club. Morrison has been without a club since leaving MLS side DC United last year where he played under ex-Blues and Derby County manager Wayne Rooney.

arts.ttl: Birmingham City star claims squad "too good for League One"
arts.sum: A Birmingham City star insists that the club's squad is "too good" for League One and that the West Midlands outfit will be back in the Championship in "six months".

arts.ttl: Wrexham and Birmingham City fined after match watched by David Beckham and Tom Brady
arts.sum: Wrexham and Birmingham were involved in a fiesty League One clash a fortnight ago, with the FA now handing out punishments to both sides after a melee erupted late into the game

arts.ttl: Birmingham City promotion rivals suffer serious injury blow as they struggle to keep pace
arts.sum: and Tuesday night's opponents - Huddersfield Town will be without first-choice goalkeeper Lee Nicholls for between 10 and 12 weeks after the stopper suffered an injury to his elbow ligaments. He's set for a stint on the sidelines, however, having suffered an elbow ligament injury earlier this year but having managed it - up until Saturday when, in the warm up ahead of their meeting with Reading, he landed awkwardly when making a save and was unable to play.

arts.ttl: Krystian Bielik opens up on ‘unbelievable’ Chris Davies and why he now enjoys playing for Birmingham City
arts.sum: With Bielik orchestrating things from the back, Paik Seung-ho and Tomoki Iwata dominating the middle ground and the likes of Jay Stansfield in attack terrorising opposition defences, Blues have made a near-perfect start to the League One season. The Blues captain added: “I’m so happy because last season I hit the crossbar, I hit the post a few times, I’m happy to be on the goal sheet again and, most importantly, it gives the team three points.”
